result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence he is currently serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Must take any Rx as prescribed. Comply with any counseling recommended. Submit DNA sample.

defendant.name: Williams, Patrick A

records.addlTxt: 1:09 PM Defendant Patrick A Williams in court, in custody.  Attorney Allison J Borsheim in court for Patrick A Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to the sole count. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentencing statements. Court withheld sentence, placed the defendant on probation for 2 years. Probation is consecutive to any sentence he is currently serving. Conditions of probation include: Must take any Rx's as prescribed. Comply with any counseling recommended. $518.00 costs. Submit DNA sample. 3 days credit. 1:47 PM
